title: Shim size calculator using color-coded thickness values

requirements.text: Create a shim size calculator UI that lets users add/remove shims by selecting from the provided color list and entering a quantity for each color, then computes the total shim stack thickness.

quotes: Make me a shim size calculator by adding the colors and mm values shown

acceptanceCriteria: The UI shows a list/table of shim colors with an input control to set quantity per color (min 0).
Users can increment/decrement quantities and also reset all quantities to 0.
The calculator shows the running total thickness as quantities change.

requirements.text: Hardcode the shim color-to-thickness mapping exactly as shown in the uploaded image and use it for all calculations: Amber=0.025mm, Purple=0.038mm, Red=0.051mm, Green=0.076mm, Tan=0.102mm, Blue=0.127mm, Matte=0.191mm, Brown=0.254mm, Black=0.318mm, Pink=0.381mm, Yellow=0.508mm, White=0.635mm, Coral=0.762mm.

quotes: adding the colors and mm values shown

acceptanceCriteria: All 13 colors from the image are present in the UI.
Each color’s mm value matches the list in this requirement.
Total thickness equals sum(quantity[color] * mm[color]) across all colors.

requirements.text: Display calculated results with clear units and sensible rounding: show total thickness in millimeters (mm) and also show the per-color subtotal (quantity × mm) for transparency.
acceptanceCriteria: Totals are displayed in mm with rounding to 3 decimal places (or better if needed to avoid visible rounding errors).
Each row shows the per-color subtotal in mm that updates when quantity changes.
A reset action restores totals and subtotals to 0.000mm.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme for the calculator (colors, typography, spacing, and layout) and use it consistently across the page; avoid a blue/purple-dominant palette.
acceptanceCriteria: The app has a consistent visual style across header, content, and controls.
The theme is not primarily blue/purple.
The UI remains readable and accessible (sufficient contrast for text and controls).

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or other frontend immutablePaths; compose those components instead if needed.
No third-party auth providers; if auth is introduced later it must use Internet Identity (not required for this request).
Backend must remain single-actor Motoko if any backend work is later added (not required for this request).
nonGoals: User accounts, login, or saving presets/history across sessions.
Integrations with external APIs or databases.
